description._content: Brooklyn's Biggest Birthday Bash! (Target First Saturday turns 10!!! ...and our court re-opens!!!!) October 4, 2008 5-11pm 5:00 p.m.–7:00 p.m. Music Public Plaza, Outside Museum Kick off the festivities by joining the parade with the funky marching band Rude Mechanical Orchestra as they blend old-fashioned brass with Brooklyn sass. 6:00 p.m.–7:30 p.m. Performance Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art, Forum, 4th Floor Transsexual trailblazer Kate Bornstein presents a multimedia signature performance “On Men, Women, and the Rest of Us.” A discussion follows. Free tickets are available at the Visitor Center at 5 p.m. 6:00 p.m.–9:00 p.m. Music Hall of the Americas, 1st Floor Hear a showcase of musical talents— Mark Yodice, Opsvik & Jennings, Christy & Emily, and Brazz Tree—each with their own unique compositions and performance styles. 6:00 p.m.–9:00 p.m. Curator Talks Meet at the gallery entrance, Throughout the Museum Ten curators give ten different talks on the Museum’s permanent collections. 6:00 p.m.–10:00 p.m. Target First Saturdays Stories Rubin Lobby, 1st Floor Find our videographers and share a Target First Saturdays memory, birthday wish, or a vision for the future, on camera, for a Target First Saturdays video. 6:30 p.m.–8:00 p.m. Dance Iris and B. Gerald Cantor Auditorium, 3rd Floor Brian Brooks Moving Company and Creative Outlet Dance Theater perform works that explore male emotional landscapes. Free tickets are available at the Visitor Center at 5 p.m. 6:30 p.m.–8:30 p.m. Hands-On Art Education Division, 1st Floor Participants are invited to make their own party hat featuring the Museum’s façade. Free timed tickets are available at the Visitor Center at 5:30 p.m. 7:00 p.m. Artist Talk Meet at the Entrance to Rotunda Gallery, 5th Floor Gilbert and George discuss their work. Free tickets are available at the Visitor Center at 5 p.m. 8:30 p.m. Film Iris and B. Gerald Cantor Auditorium, 3rd Floor In 24 Hour Party People (Michael Winterbottom, 2002, 117 min., R) an acclaimed British director tells the story of the influential label Factory Records, capturing the magic and madness of Manchester's music scene from the late 1970s to the mid-1990s. Free tickets are available at the Visitor Center at 7 p.m. 9:00 p.m.–11:00 p.m. Dance Party The Rubin Pavillion, 1st Floor Art party fixtures and creative duo, DJ Andrew Andrew heat up the dance floor as they zig-zag through the history of popular dance music. 9:00 p.m.–11:00 p.m. Special Salsa Dance Party Beaux-Arts Court, 3rd Floor New salsa sensation Trombori, led by salsa trombonist extraordinaire Willie Alvarez, brings back a familiar favorite of Target First Saturdays dance parties.
